home.digitalDivideDesc: There is a need in the broader industry across the continent to shift to the next generation of digital products. A broader, more multi-faceted market is asking for more sophisticated and relevant products beyond person-to-person payments. There are evident opportunities to develop digital banking, savings and credit products, as well as the digitization of value chain financing and merchant payments. This can significantly improve customer benefits and usage, as well as long-term sustainability for providers.
home.changingDesc: By launching low-cost financial services we aim to develop new technological approaches and innovative business models. Both are opportunities and challenges in furthering financial inclusion

about.title: We support you in achieving your projects!
about.intro: At Afira, we believe that financial inclusion is a powerful lever for transforming lives and building a sustainable future. Our mission is to democratize access to financial services and economic education, especially for those often left behind by traditional systems: young women, students, informal workers, and aspiring entrepreneurs. We combine mobile technology, flexible microcredit, and accessible educational content to provide everyone with concrete tools for financial autonomy.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: A world where every young woman entrepreneur, every informal worker can access the resources needed to realize their ideas, escape precariousness, and become an actor in their future.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Access is not enough. True inclusion means creating solutions for those who are systematically forgotten: women, rural populations, low-income communities. We develop inclusive digital services that are: Affordable, Easy to use, even with low digital literacy, Available in local languages, Relevant to daily needs. This is not a network issue. It's a human issue.

whyAfira.title: Why Afira
whyAfira.description: Mobile connectivity is now an essential driver of digital transformation and socio-economic growth in Sub-Saharan Africa. According to the GSMA Mobile Economy 2024 report: 'Mobile technology contributes to SDG 4, which aims to ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities.' 'Digital transformation makes educational resources more accessible, improves learning outcomes, and supports continuous learning.' We build on these findings to design a platform that strengthens community capabilities and generates lasting impact.
